#labels Phase-Deploy
Instructions how to get going with ICE Explorer

=Requirements=
These items are required by ICE Explorer and need to be installed first:

 * PyOpenGL
 * PyQt
 * Numpy

= Installation =
Download the latest zip-file and run "python iceexplorer.py".

= Loading ICECache Data =
You can either load a folder containing a sequence of .icecache files:
 * File | Load Cache Folder ... 

Or an individual .icecache file. 
 * File | Load Cache File ... 

= Viewing =
You can navigate the 3D view with one of these tools: pan, orbit and zoom. They are all located in the 'Tools' toolbar. You can use view presets to display the ICE cache data: perspective, top, front, right: The presets can be selected from the 'View' toolbar.
 
= Browser =
The Browser window contains a tree widget for listing .icecache files information. Since attribute values can be quite large, they are not loaded automatically when cache files are loaded. You can load them with the 'Display Data' context menu by right-clicking the mouse on the attribute name. You can also display all attribute data of a cache by right-clicking on the Cache tree item.

= Export to ascii =
File caches can be exported to ascii files:
 * File | Export Cache Folder ...
 * File | Export Cache File ...

You can also export caches from the Browser window by right-clicking on a Cache files or attribute name. 

= Playback =
The play back window allows you animate the cache
